recipe.name: Lemon Pepper Pork
recipe.description: A complete meal on the table in just 15 minutes! Made from scratch, so fresh and easy.
recipeIngredient: 2  pork cutlets (, at room temperature (200g/7oz each, bone in) (see notes))
1/2 cup boiling water ((or chicken or vegetable stock/broth))
50 g / 1.5 oz g / 1.5 oz   feta cheese
Lemon wedges or cheeks (, to serve (optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Combine couscous and boiling water in a bowl, cover with cling wrap and set aside for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine couscous and boiling water in a bowl, cover with cling wrap and set aside for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle lemon pepper on both sides of each cutlet and pat to make it stick.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle lemon pepper on both sides of each cutlet and pat to make it stick.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in fry pan over high heat. Place pork in fry pan and cook the first side for 2 minutes and the second side for 1 1/2 minutes or until cooked to your liking. I like mine medium rare. Remember the pork will continue to cook while resting.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in fry pan over high heat. Place pork in fry pan and cook the first side for 2 minutes and the second side for 1 1/2 minutes or until cooked to your liking. I like mine medium rare. Remember the pork will continue to cook while resting.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pork from the fry pan onto a plate, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove pork from the fry pan onto a plate, cover loosely with foil and set aside to rest.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in the fry pan still on high heat. Add onion and capsicum and sauté for 1 minute, then add the zucchini. Stir and cook the vegetables until charred and just cooked through. Remove pan from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in the fry pan still on high heat. Add onion and capsicum and sauté for 1 minute, then add the zucchini. Stir and cook the vegetables until charred and just cooked through. Remove pan from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Fluff up the couscous with a fork. Add the vegetables and mint leaves. Squeeze over a drizzle of lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Fluff up the couscous with a fork. Add the vegetables and mint leaves. Squeeze over a drizzle of lemon juice and season to taste with salt and pepper. Toss gently to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide couscous between plates, scatter over feta cheese. Top with pork cutlet and drizzle over resting juices. Serve with lemon cheeks or wedges on the side, if using.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide couscous between plates, scatter over feta cheese. Top with pork cutlet and drizzle over resting juices. Serve with lemon cheeks or wedges on the side, if using.

review.reviewBody: So delicious!  Quick, easy, healthy.  I added a few cherry tomatoes in at the end.  I'll be making this one again. Thanks.

Thanks Nagi!
This has become a staple on my cooking list. It is so versatile - I've found you can use any meat with any dry rub or marinade. So quick and delicious.

Delicious!
Restaurant qualitymeal.
 I made it with spring onion  instead of red onion.
A family winner, will make this again. Simple, easy, and tasty. I Will make next time I entertain
Husband and I loved it. Delicious, really light but full of flavor.

Oh this was not just a 6, but over the fence and out!!! What a winner! So juicy and the piquancy of the lemon was like we had never tasted before.
Would cost a fortune in a restaurant.
So glad we found this site!

I made this baby last night  on the BBQ (still waiting for 8month old stove to be replaced).
the pork chops were really, really tasty.     I patted the chops with lemony olive oil before adding lemon pepper and left for about 10mins for the flavours to intense.

Wow, the veges were a highlight for me, the colours and flavours were perfect.    I also whacked in some corn cobs and since MOTH really enjoys beetroot, I cubed a few slices and this added another flavour that seriously worked well.

The meal was so quick to prepare and cook and gosh, the washing up was next to nothing.

We really enjoyed this one (as usual), thanks Nagi.
Just made this last night. I am not a cook so thanks for an easy, affordale, healthy delicious recipe.

This is a gorgeous meal! And 15 minutes...I am seriously impressed! Pinning and sharing - can't wait to try it! If you have a free moment Thursday night, I would love it if you would link it up with us at Foodie Fridays (we go live at 9 pm EST)...everyone is looking for meals that take less time these days! Plus this is so healthy!

author.name: Michelle @ A Dish of Daily Life

review.reviewBody: How incredible that this is ready in less than 15 minutes!  These pictures look incredible too, wonderful recipe!

That plate looks extremely fresh and beautiful! The combination of flavors is perfect, and it sounds like a real 15 minute meal, with the great shortcuts you provided :) Rushing to cook a meal in 15 minutes and then having to wash many pans and dishes and also using most of your kitchen appliances is not fun :)
